tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Dr. Chirag Thonse, an absolute magician! True magic in his hands and I can say it by my firsthand experience. My ACL reconstruction was due for almost 3 years and what I did during this time was researched and tried all possible means to have my ligament back to avoid an operation. Now with the numerous videos on YouTube about ACL repair/reconstruction of which few are motivating by a step and few demotivating back by several steps, to sum up on the outcome of the research that I did, I was confused and afraid of a surgery and hence the reason to the delay. Well I must admit that I have consulted many Doctors and have no count of the number of MRI‚Äôs that I have taken in an expectation to see if my ligament has improved by time. Dr. Chirag Thonse was one such doctor whom I met and with the discussion on the approach and the confidence he gave me I was convinced, at that point I felt I need to get the reconstruction procedure done right away then and there. It was in March 2020 that I consulted Dr. Chirag and in April 2020 I underwent the surgery, mind you it was the lockdown and yes he operated my ACL with the pandemic around. On the experiences from the blogs and videos that I had I was certain of the post operation pain and was nervous beyond normal. The day of operation, it was no less than thriller with my heart pounding hard and all the prep-up going on for the procedure. Finally I was at the operation theatre witnessing the entire procedure on the TV/monitor while Dr. Chirag and team were in action. After the operation I was under care for almost 2 hours and later shifted to my ward. All that I was awaiting and prepared for was the post-op pain, the night of the operation I experienced it but not to the extent that I had read and watched. I thought probably it is the anesthesia and the pain management doses keeping me away from pain. The next day morning I was made to walk, yes you heard it was the very next day and it was indeed surprising that I was doing absolutely fine and walked quite a distance with the Physio‚Äôs support (never expected this at all). Only disappointment was that there was no pain at all that day, all my expectation was in vain :). I got discharged on the second day. After a week I called up Dr. Chirag and expressed the expectation that I had and I asked Doctor, how can there be no paint at all? He smiled and said, that‚Äôs why people get their ACL surgery done with me. I must also stress on the fact that Dr. Chirag leaves no stone unturned in terms of taking care of his patients, I have been in touch with him for 8 months now, I am able to jog, jump and squat. I am really blessed and fortunate to have the ACL surgery done by him. He guides you at every step on the journey to progress and the upcoming milestones, to top it all his patience is that of a Saint for the number of patients he has and he operates on a day to day basis. **** *** **** **** **** ** *** ** ** ************* *** *** ****** * **** *** * ********* Thank you Doctor for what you have done, I will remain thankful to you forever

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
Visited Dr. Chirag with a left knee injury. He patiently  listened & allowed me to speak to give him all the details like how the injury happened, which part of my knee I had more pain etc. After analyzing my injury, with the help of knee model, he explained me in detail about my injury & what was the impacted of injury. After looking at the MRI scan, he did not rush & asked me undergo surgery immediately, but took 10 days‚Äô time to analysis further with medication & some exercise. 

I had to undergo ACL & Meniscus balancing surgery. For Dr. Chirag his patients are more important to him, he takes care of them very well and treats them with utmost care. Either its pre or post-surgery, he make a point that his patients understand everything about the injury, surgery & medication by explaining even the smallest of the things that we need to know. He explained the procedures clearly & post operation what are step of recovery process and how long it will take by giving the timeline including the Physiotherapy process. He put me across to the best physiotherapists, he takes extra care of his patient by giving & getting the right treatment done his patients.

Dr. Chirag has a wonderful team, they made me to feel so comfortable & helpful during my stay in hospital. I would like to Thank all the team members of Doctor & special call out to Mrs. Yasmin for all her support, right from day one.

Thank a lot Dr. Chirag for everything you have done and wish you lots of success in you future

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
I had first visited the doctor in the month of October‚Äô20 for my mother‚Äôs frozen shoulder. Doctor was able to diagnose and referred to Physiotherapy and prescribed some medication. The meeting was very short and very cold, I was ok because at least we had an action plan. My mother suffering from colitis *** ********* ****** **** ********* ***** I told doctor and he asked to stop. Here was my first setback, when I asked doctor what next, there was no response. When I insisted and asked that shall we come and meet you, he very casually said ‚Äúyes, you may come‚Äù. Second meeting as well was cold and he simply said to continue physiotherapy. Alright, we continued for a month, then again visited. The meeting, response and everything remained same very cold, I mean there was no personal touch at all, as if we are meeting for the first time, no patient history no track, simply a visit. I was a little frustrated by this time as my mother was not getting better. As it was about 2 months now, I asked doctor any idea how much time it is going to take, shall we change physiotherapy, or basically is there a plan. The answer was again very cold that ‚Äúit‚Äôs going to take one year and I‚Äôm not a physiotherapist so cannot tell what needs to be changed‚Äù. I immediately decided to switch because I felt that it doesn‚Äôt matter for him, ******* ********* ** ** *** ******* **** ******* ******** *** ** *** ** ****** ***** I had to penetrate to get an answer, otherwise doctor was very much ok to just simply spend ‚Äúnot more than 10 mins‚Äù in each visit.

Then I switched ** **** ** ****** ****** *** *** *** *** ****** *********** ** *********** **** * ***** *** *** ****** *** **** ********* ********* *** **** ********** **** **** ** **** ** ******* ** ** * ****** ***** **** **** ** **** *** ** **** ***** ** ***** ** ***** *** * *** ******* *** ************ ** ** *******

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,Value for money,
review: My experience with chirag Thonse was 1 month back, when I visited him with my parents for a back pain problem. I went on a good reference to him. Was made to wait for more than 2 hours & on finely meeting him. *** ** **** **** ******** **** **** My mother is aged 70 years & takes time to process information. Chirag Thonse had no patience to listen with empathy, nor explain the medication properly. He rushed through the entire consultation & walked off abruptly after giving a medical opinion. My mother tried showing him the old prescriptions & medical files of consultations with specialist hospital, but he just shut the file & said, there's no need to see it. We were offended by his rude behaviour & impatient nature. On Asking him to repeat the medication prescribed, he stared at my mother & directed her to go out & speak to the assistant to explain. We had a a bad experience with him & were uncomfortable with his behaviour. The second time we visited him in the hennur clinic & faced a similar rushed consultation with him. We will never return again to consult with him, as we prefer to pay & see a doctor that has patience, ******** ** ****** * **** *** ***** *** *** ** *** * ********* I don't recommend chirag Thonse to anyone.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I was very nervous after my mri report says miniscus tear... Because sports is my life.. And what would happen if I can't train again. So I went to Dr Chirag Recomened by my physio... He explained me the whole problem... And Recomened a surjery to be done.  The costing of the surjery was very reasonable. When I arranged my finances... I was admitted in Vikram hospital and there the surgery went very smooth... Even there was a madam... She helped me the best possible way, starting from before surgery meeting the doctor to getting admitted in the hospital, and following up every now and then. Keeping me updated. She was very kind and helpful. I was able to see what was going on for the whole time..in the operation theatre

 Every time I had any doubt Chirag sir and madam  would address it with care. Even post surgery also the medicines which he suggested helped me to recover faster. Overall a great experience. Now it has been around 5 months.. And I can swim and cycle.. And started jogging also. Overall a amazing experience. And yes a great great team ortho clinic. Wish you all the best.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
** ****** ** *** ** *** **** ********** ******** **** ** **** **** ******** A family member  had persistent knee pain in both legs and her back for a long time.  She was petrified of Doctors and refused to visit one. A friend recommended Dr Chirag and there was no looking back.  On her very first visit to the Doctor, he patiently listened to all her complaints and answered all her questions. She was convinced that she was in safe hands and agreed to go ahead with the surgery. He convinced her that she will be able to walk normally again.

Most importantly the surgery was a success and her recovery was uneventful. She was made to walk the next day of the surgery.  This was incredible.

Everyone whom we came into contact with both at the Clinic and the hospital - the Radiologist, the anesthesiologist, the nurses, the physiotherapists,, the Doctor's personal assistants all went out of their way to make the patient comfortable during her 4 day stay in the hospital.

Dr Chirag is a friendly, patient, compassionate, dedicated Doctor whose only aim is to put his patients back on their feet. Doctor is personally involved in the post operative recovery of his patients and never fails to answer or return a call.

A great Doctor and a blessed human being!!

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Wait time,
Wait time,Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,
review:
We had a very bad experience with this doctor. We choose this doctor because of a lot of positive reviews.
My mother's right knee was displaced and her leg wasn't straight she used to hobble but she did not experience any pain.
The doctor suggested knee replacement surgery and we went ahead with it as he assured us that
this is a common operation and within a couple of weeks, my mother could walk normally.
He didn't caution us at all about any potential failures *** ******* ******* ***** *** **** *********** ****** *** *** **** *** ****** Even after 4 months my mother's leg still isn't straight 
and she still hobbles. The bad part is that she experiences slight pain when she walks but at night the pain 
becomes so unbearable that she has to take a pain killer.

The doctor tried to place plaster twice (one week each) post surgery but the moment the plasters are removed
the leg goes back to the same position. ***** ****** ******* ** *** ******** ** ** *** **** ** ********** The bad part is he also placed the 
blame on my mother once stating that the patient is not co-operating and the problem is in her mental 
state and asked us to get counseling.
There is no sympathy from the doctor's side.**** ********* *** ************** **** ** **** **** * **** ****** ** *** *** ** ******** ********* **** **** **** 

At present we are consulting another doctor and we are seeing improvements.
Although the leg still isn't straight at least the pain has reduced a lot and there is no need to take painkillers.

We really regret getting this surgery done. We would never recommend this doctor to anyone.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
"God only had sent you to the Dr Chirag Thonse". Said, my friend. I told myself that how he was so right I thanked God and Dr Chirag.
Dr Chirag treated me with orthoscopy and HTO surgery on my right knee successfully 15 days ago.
Long ago, I have got some meniscus injury but managed it with physio and regular exercises.  Over the last year, my pain has increased, and I referred the physio by an orthopaedic doctor. However, the pain has become medium severe over the previous two weeks.
I went back to the same reputed hospital, where I showed earlier. After seeing the X-ray, the orthopaedic surgeon has advised me for the total knee replacement as an only option. With my shock, I agreed to the surgery immediately, but somehow, I was not convinced, considering my X-ray report.
My friends, known doctors and relatives have advised me for a second opinion. Also, I enquired from several patients who underwent such surgeries. Finally, I have referred to Dr Chirag firmly to have a second opinion before the knee replacement.
Dr Chirag has seen my X-ray and examines my knee movements physically, and at the outset, he said, you are not the candidate for the knee joint replacement. However, to decide the proper treatment, he asked me for an immediate MRI.
Ruling out total knee replacement, He gave me the right option for minimum invasive surgery to repair my Meniscus and bone realignment through arthroscopy and HTO, respectively.
After two weeks of the successful surgery, I am recovering well and feeling relieved with the postoperative procedure.
What I felt best with my treatment experience with Dr Chirag is his approach to conserve the natural knee joint as much as possible, correct diagnosis of the problem and treatment, a huge passion for his field, and his and his team's professionalism.
I admire him a lot *** ***** *** ** *** **** *********** ******** ********* ********* ** *******My gratitude to you, Dr Chirag!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Dr chirag sir is an extremely nice person, very humble, patient, cheerful and joy to talk to.  He takes time to explain any small doubt and silly doubts that you have. In my case i needed an ACL reconstruction and meniscus repair . Its been 9 weeks since surgery and i am walking and jogging properly without any pain. Dr chirag sir also put me across to the best physio therapists and takes care of every patient so that they get right treatment. He has a wonderful team , they made me so comfortable during my stay in the hospital. I would like to thank all the team members of doctor especially dr suman sir  and also Yasmin mam at the clinic for all the support and taking care of all the appointments. I highly recommend dr chirag sir for any orthopaedic or sports injury.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: I am happy and glad to give review about Dr. Chirag Thonse. Dr. Chirag Thonse is truly professional *** ****** ******* ********** *******. I will definitely suggest who are having orthopedic problems should consult him. I got my ACL reconstruction of my left knee along with meniscal repair.  I got discharged on the same day of surgery. Now 4 months after the surgery I am able to walk pain free. My recovery is going well as per the plan and regular follow-ups. Dr has amazing staff to support you with any queries and taking care of insurance etc. Overall I am satisfied and whole heartedly recommend to whoever having orthopedic issues.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I went to Dr.Chirang with my already operated left knee for ACL and meniscus and reconstruction and repair of the Meniscus thrice. Currently on Grade 2 of osteoarthritis on the right knee and Dr.Chirag examined and clearly explained the issues with my right knee as it had inflammation due to early onset of  osteoarthritis which came up on examination... Explained the situation well and medications given very effective within 24 hours.... I am very happy that i got his reference and so close to home.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Dr. Chirag Thonse was reffered to me by my family Doctor.. I had this severe pain in my left hand from 5to 6 months and had visited many Doctors for solution.. But many gave me false information about the ailment I had. 
Dr. Chirag took very less time to identify my problem, he suggested few medicines nd has asked me to visit him after 7 days with a Xray report. I already have some relief within 2 days of taking tablets.. He's a very genuine Doctor.. I would suggest everyone whoever have any ortho related problems to go visit him..

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I visited Dr Chirag in Jan‚Äô21 for shoulder disability. He told us about the issue very clearly and said it is required to go for surgery.
He told us the detail plan of operation and post operation recovery plans. 
I had undergone ARTHOROSCOPIC LEFT SHOULDER BANKART‚ÄôS on 12th Feb‚Äô21
I am very grateful to Dr Chirag for the surgery conducted and I am seeing a speedy recovery. I strongly recommend Dr.Chirag Thonse, *** **** ********** ******** God gave you wonderful talent that you continue to share with others. I feel there are no words to express my deep felt thanks and gratitude to you Dr.Chirag. 
A special Thanks to the entire orthopedic team of Dr Chirag.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: I had this knee pain issues for almost close to 4 years. Since hospitals were not my choice, i decided to bear the pain, but it got to an imbearable situation and surgery was necessary.  So i decided to take an opinion from several doctors just so i could avoid the surgery. Then i was directed to see Dr. Chirag Thonse on the first visit the way it was communicated to me by Dr. Thonse. I got the confidence to agree to the surgery. On my 2nd visit I decided to go ahed with the surgery, for this I am happy my quick decision saved me a lot of pain, and the amazing thing was I started walking without assistance in the 3rd week. After physio I was able to start work within 50 days after the surgery. Thanks to Dr. Thonse.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
I really like the approach the doctor took in explaining the procedure for ACL reconstruction surgery. He explained the procedures itself, post operation what are the timeline for each step of recovery process. How long it will take for each step of the Physio Therapy. 

Extremely happy with the procedure itself and post operation have been able to reach each milestone as expected and timeline provided by Dr. 

Hope to make a full recovery and get back to an active  lifestyle like before 

Thanks Dr. Chirag

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Doctor spends less than 30sec with each patient. He has very little time to listen to your problem. He doesn't explain anything clearly. I was initially diagnosed wrongly. Empathy is missing. He is in very hurry always. Our experience has been same at both centers Cox town and Kothanur.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Dr. Chirag and his team is very good. I had consulted him for AVN surgery and its been 2 years. I had seen much improvement from then. I was very skeptical as the one hip is in stage2 and other one was stage3. He explained the problem and suggested for latest treatment(OSSGROW).    I strongly recommend him for different kinds of sport injuries.
